version_description: Bugfix: When calculating the summary for the reading list for a few web sites, the App could crash (affected the sync with Instapaper, because Instapaper does not provide a summary itself)

- Now, iCab is able to warn the user when visiting web sites which contain malware or try to steal personal data (phishing). This feature uses the "Google Safe Browsing" service and can be enabled in the "Services" settings. This feature works by regularl

- It is now possible to inspect the SSL certificates of web sites which use encrypted connections ("https"). To display the certificate chain and certificate details, just use the "SLL certificates" options from the "Fav Icons" menu (tap on the icon at th

There are some refinements for the Reader mode:
- When printing a page in "reader mode" the menu of the reader mode will be hidden and the background will be set to white for the printout.
- The "Read now“ feature can be added as icon into the toolb

- The twin mode can be also enabled via gesture
- In the „Help“ section there's a new "search" feature
- The reading mode allows to change the font
- The contextual menu of the download managers is configurable in the "User Interface" settings

- There's a new option "Auto" for the option "Display IDN" (IDN: International Domain Name) in the Network settings. This option will display all IDNs with the exception of those which contain characters that look similar to those with the ASCII range. Th

- While the Twin browser was switched off, it could nevertheless happen that the tabs of the Twin browser were listed in the Tabs menu.
- Fixes an issue with wrong preview images of the quickstarter
- When copying URLs (via Copy & Paste) into th

- New option „Open Photo in Tab“ for contextual menu available
- New option "Use Colors for menu icons" under "Settings > User Interface > Design" added. With this option you can decide if the colors defined for the browser view should be also us

- Now, the "Edit" mode of the bookmarks window allows to select multiple bookmarks, so it is possible to delete or move a larger number of bookmarks in one go. Just set the checkmarks for all bookmarks you want to add to the selection. You can also tap on

- In the Downloads window iCab displays the download date for each file.
- In the Downloads window iCab Mobile shows a preview image for all photos and pictures
- You can add an option to open the RSS feed of the current page into the Action and Fav
Fixes a crash when tapping on the address field under iOS 9 and older. When using iOS 10 or newer, this update is not needed.

- Duplicating a tab will now also include the back/forward history
- When sending feedback via E-Mail from within the "support" section of the built-in "help" there are also some other E-Mail Apps supported (if installed), besides the default Mail opti

- Bugfix: When opening all bookmarks from a bookmarks folder at once, iCab displays the number of bookmarks, but did also count the separator items. Now, only the bookmarks are counted.
- Bugfix: On certain websites it could happen that buttons did no

- Added Drag & Drop support for the iPad under iOS 11.
You can drag Bookmarks, History entries, Reading list items, Links and the FavIcon as web addresses and Download entries as files. The App is able to receive web addresses in the bookmarks an

- Drag & Drop support for links on web sites can be disabled in the User Interface settings as well
- Bugfix: The bookmarks window will remember the last scroll position again under iOS 11
- Bugfix: if an extremely large text size was configured

- Fixes an issue on an iPhone X where the address field was misplaced while extering an address.
- Fixes an issue where the contextual menu was opened when selecting text
- External Passwort Managers can be called by a keyboard shortcut (Bluetooth k

- On iPhone X the background color of the screen area which can not be used in landscape mode ("Notch") will be set to the one of the current web site
- Bugfix: Fixes the issue under iOS 11, where reordering entries in the bookmarks and downloads could

- Bugfix: In certain cases the App could crash when iCloud sync was enabled, I’m sorry for this.

- Bugfix for iPhone X: In fullscreen mode the address field could be still partly hidden if the status bar was switched off.

- Under iOS 11 it is now possible to pick TLS 1.3 as minimum version for secure connections (Attention: right now most web sites do not yet support this)
- Bugfix: The Export/Import feature via WLAN does work again
- Fixes a few smaller issues

- Until now the icons (for the "modern design") were drawn normal or bold depending of the accessiblity option "bold text" from the system settings. Now you can also configure this independently from the accessibilty setting in the "User Interface > De

- In the Download Manager there's a new option to sort the files.

- In the Download Manager you can now define rules to post-process downloads. These rules allow to move different file types to different folders, copy pictures into the Album fully

DARK MODE

There's new feature, called "Dark Mode". The dark mode draws user interface and web site with dark colors, so this mode is great for reading in the night. Also on the iPhone X this mode can save battery power.

The Dark mode can be
Fixes a crash with Face ID, if Face ID was enabled in V9.11 of iCab Mobile the very first time

- Search feature for history added
- In addition to the page preview image for the Quickstarter you can now also use the FavIcons of the site (if available). This can be configured in the settings under "Personal data > Quickstarter".

- Bugfi

- The download icon in the toolbar provides information about the progress of the downloads via VoiceOver (if enabled)
- Bugfix: The "fragment identifier" of an URL was not evaluated in local HTML files of the downloads window
- Bugfix: fixes an iss

- Support for new iPhone models added (XS, XS Max, XR)
- Support for new iPad Pro models added (11", 12.9")
- Bugfix: if the auto-fullscreen mode with the "scroll" option was enabled, tabs became invisible after switching tabs via swipe gesture
-

- Because the iOS does not longer support to switch on/off the status bar on iPhone X/XR/XS/XS Max, the options to configure the status bar is no longer available on these iPhone models.
- Bugfix: Solves issues with the status bar under iOS 12
- Bug

- The Favorites icon is now also available on the iPad for the fullscreen mode
- The preview for the file icons in the downloads manager is available for several additional file types
- Bugfix: In case a web site initiates the "print" command before

- The command "Copy Address" can be now also assigned to a multitouch gesture.
- When dragging text into a text field of a form within a web site, iCab Mobile will now simulate some keystrokes, so that web sites which do not accept new text that was no

- It's now possible to add options to delete private data (like history, cookies, etc) into the action menu.
- Loading of web archives (saved web pages) does work under iOS 12 again
- Dragging Quickstarter items around to reorder them did not work i

- It's now possible to access the modules list from within the action menu (when configured this way).
- It's now possible to configure a multi-finger tap gesture to open a link in a new tab. For example you could tap a link with 2 fingers to open it i

- New option to switch the WebEngine (requires iOS 11 or later).
The iOS provides two APIs for its web engine, the 'classic' and the 'modern' one. The latter is supposed to replace the former, unfortunately it's still lacking a lot of features of

- Fixes a bug which had the effect that some RSS feeds were no longer recognised as RSS feed.
- Fixes an issue with multitouch gestures assigned to actions which load web sites when using the modern web engine
- Fixes an issue with the "password fil

- There are changes for the dark mode of iCab Mobile under iOS 13 in order to avoid conflicts with the new system-wide dark mode or iOS 13. Under iOS 13 the user interface of iCab Mobile will be always linked to the dark mode of the iOS. So if you enable

- The reading list can be now accessed from within the action menu (as an option)
- Bugfix: When switching the web engine the App could crash if there were a lot of cookies stored in the browser
- Bugfix: Under iOS 13 it was possible to close the lo

- Bugfix: Solves an issue of iOS 13 which made it sometimes difficult to set or move the text cursor in the address field
- Bugfix: A bug within the iOS could prevent that cookies were filtered correctly when using the modern web engine
- Bugfix: A
Sorry, a workaround for an iOS 13 bug had an unwanted side effect on the copy & paste feature when using the modern web engine, this is fixed now

- Adds a workaround for an iOS 13 issue with the virtual keyboard. It could happen that while typing on keyboard elements which are hidden by the keyboard could be triggered as well.
- Bugfix: If the "design" setting configures white text/icons on a da

- New Option: if loading images is disabled, you can long-press the reload button in the address field to get an option to load the page with all images.
- Updated the predefined Browser IDs to more recent browser releases.
- Bugfix: When using the

- New web debugging module added: "Eruda"
- Now, files from the downloads can be also stored in the quickstarter
- Fixes an issue with a bluetooth keyboard and the modern web engine: it was impossible to switch between twin browsers using the cursor
Fixes an issue under older iOS releases (iOS 10 and older), where the address field did not respond to touches. This update is not relevant when using iOS 11 and newer

- A bug within the new iOS 13.4 can prevent that you can still select text on web sites. This iOS bug only affects iPads when using the modern web engine and only if the option to show a link preview together with the contextual menu is disabled. Therefor

Sorry, there was a small issue left in the last release, which is fixed now: When still using the classic engine on an iPad, the contextual menu did not open with a very specific combination of settings.

- Because iOS 13 introduces new system-wide three finger gestures for copy & paste operations and these system gestures are even active when nothing can be copied or pasted, iCab's own 3-finger gestures could no longer be used. Now, if the user has co

- Firefox Sync introduced a new validation method for logins. iCab Mobile supports this new validation method now.
- Fixes a bug when parsing "x-callback-url" URLs where a "query" part exists which contains certain characters
- Fixes a few modules w

- When using the modern web engine it could happen that Tabs lost their content if the device is running out of free memory (usually when a large number of Tabs were open and/or these sites consumed a large amount of memory). Now, iCab Mobile stores addit

- There's a new "undo" feature available for bookmarks, so you can undo the last change that was done to the bookmarks. In order to undo changes within the bookmarks, enable the "Edit" mode and then you can find the "undo" botton in the toolbar of the boo
Minor improvements and fixes

- iCab Mobile can be configured as Default Browser under iOS 14. In order to do this, please open the "Settings" App from the homescreen, here open the settings for iCab Mobile. Now you can change the default browser to "iCab Mobile". This way other Apps

- The new filters of version 10.0 are different to the filters of older iCab versions. Therefore the old exception filters won't work anymore. The new version of iCab Mobile did convert the old filters into the noew format, but unfortunately because of a
